Topic.Title: Dell -- the best value in value investing.

Message.Msg: I am on very light margin, and full diversification as it has always been. I won't tell you to sell your house to buy a stock. Investment is an art in life. It should be a balanced approach based on your own criteria. Though I see Dell as having the most compelling risk/reward ratio in the universe where we live, my portfolio still stretches boardly across different industry segments. I buy pharmaceutical, as well as biotech too. Like someone said in an interview at CNBC days ago, it is crazy not to be on equity. Dividends, PE Ratio, Cash Assets, Cash flows, all these point to a significantly higher market ahead. Stock prices have to appropriately truly reflect all these magnificient elements. The stock market is still fundammentally considerably undervalued as a whole. And there are some stocks, like Dell, that will even outperform this up and coming rising market. Happy Thanksgiving And Smart And Confident Investing!

Dell is breaking up downside pattern triangle on daily graphs. time to get into this undervalued company. Nice free-cash flow, debt ratio is great, Windows 8 as a catalyst + new blade servers. I love this company at such low P/E. Discounted Cash Flow show great upside potential.

Message.Title: SELL SELL SELL SELL
Message.Msg: Beware, HUGE SELL is coming. Top price reached for today. Get your cents and go away b4 it plunge
